result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert R Seamars was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid in 30 days or penalty of 14 days jail for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Robert R Seamars in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 2 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
FINE: $479.00 to be paid within 30 days or serve 14 days in jail
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 to be paid within 30 days
